metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
With papers of 1760 [written in corner of paper in pencil at later date]

To the Honourable the Members of the Society of Saint Andrews Club --

The Petition of Agnis [Agnes]  Bell, the [illegible] of Robert Bell, heretofore of Berekely County, Deceased

Humbly Sheweth --

That Your Petitioner was Left About 12 Months Since a Widow, And Strip't of all the Necessarys [necessities] of Life, by the Credittors [creditors] to the Estate of her Said Deceased husband, who Left not The Value of One Farthing, for the Support of your Poor Petitioner and Three Children, the Eldest, 11 and the Youngest 3 Years of Age, And Forasmush as your Poor Petitioner (Notwithstanding all her Industry to Maintain and Support herself, And Said Children) Find Her Endeavours That way Fruitless, the times being Very hard and no help Yet Offered to, or received by her Your Petitioner, therefore Most Humbly Presumes, to Beg Your Charitable Consideration of the Deplorable Circumstances of Your Poor Distressed Petitioner.

And as in Duty Bound, She will Ever Pray,
Agnes Bell [signature of applicant]
